location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Copy of letter No 1651/458 of 1872 from Colonel Lewis Pelly, HBM's Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bombay, to The Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter enclosing a copy of letter No. 615/192 of 1872 from the Political Agent at Muscat, Edward Charles Ross, concerning the state of affairs between His Highness the Sultan of Muscat [Turki bin Said Al-Said] and His Highness Seyed Saulem [Soulem II bin Thuwaini Al-Said].The letter requests Government's instructions on whether it would be acceptable for either Pelly or Ross, as Political Agent, to mediate between them.
